channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Appliances abandoned on the side of the path, 15th May
item.description:
A microwave, a child’s car seat and other rubbish left between cycling path to Gotherington and Gotherington lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pole with parking restrictions has been dangerously knocked over, now lying at a 30 degree angle to the pavement, 15th May
item.description:
1 Hatherley Court Road GL51 3AQ The pole with parking restrictions attached has been knocked over and is leaning dangerously along the pavement at a 30 degree angle to the pavement, rather than upright at 90 degrees. This is a road with 2 parks, therefore many pedestrians often with wheelchairs or pushchairs and the position of this pole is now a dangerous hazard which needs urgently fixing. Whilst writing one of the mirrors at the junction of Hatherley Court Road for access to Hatherley Road has been missing for months, making this a very dangerous junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: 4 Gladstone Road white line, 15th May
item.description:
Following the resurfacing of the road last year, can you please repaint the white line that was previously outside the house.

item.title: Dead fox, 15th May
item.description:
Dead fox on southern pavement, opposite the driveway to no. 155, where the path to Barley Rd comes out. It has been partially covered by a white cloth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 155, New Barn Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient repair of damaged pavement, 15th May
item.description:
The damaged area of pavement outside numbers 17 and 18 has been reported and today repair work was carried out. Unfortunately, as you can see in the photo, they only resurfaced a small area - the workmen said they didn’t have enough tarmac to do the full width. Could you please send someone back out to do the repair properly? They also said the overgrown hedge and weeds on the pavement would need clearing so they could get all the way to the end. Are you able to action this too please? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th May
item.description:
in relation a dead tree in question has caused damage to a brick wall and driveway, repairs have been done and roots are what’s caused the damage, also has affected neighbours property. The tree itself was never intended to be planted many years ago and just randomly got put in place.
Report on FixMyStreet
